item.title: Networking in C
item.description:
A project made using the C language, the library “Unity” to make tests units and the integrated socket librairies. It allows you to create a UDP or TCP server, or client, and connect them to send messages. You can also using TCP ask a webserver to get the main page content and then it prints it in the shell.

Exemple of use of the project (connecting TCP server and client ):

Click here to see the code / download the project.

item.title: Space invaders
item.description:
Click here to play the game.

A personnal project realised mostly in Javascript with the P5.js library. This is a Space invaders game with some free images, optimised, available online and with some possibilites (change the difficulty, fireworks when you win or lose…) You move with the keyboard arrows and fire by pressing space.

Click here to see the code.

item.title: Fireworks JS
item.description:
Click here to play the game.

This small project is in 3 parts, normal fireworks, fireworks with images for the particules (I used the faces of some friends for it) and the most interesting one, fireworks as text. All of it was realized using P5.js a Javascript library.

Click here to see the code.

item.title: Mastermind JS
item.description:
Click here to play the game.

This project was realized with a classmate for the human-manchine interface class. This was our first project with Javascript and considering the game isn’t responsive it might not work correctly depending on the size of your screen. Nevertheless, this was an interesting experience to use CSS animations for the menu or making the game mechanics work.

Click here to see the code.

item.title: Java first animation with Swing
item.description:
One of my first personnal programming projects which made me discover at the same time Eclipse, Java and Swing a library directly integrated in the Java JDK to make graphical interfaces. It isn’t optimized at all and not very practical to setup (you need to download the last release on github, dezip it and launch the jar file or clone the github repository and put in the folder the correct JRE) but it works fine and have some easter eggs. link to see the releases and download the last one

This project was made before all for fun and have some jokes (especially a mode JUL like the french singer, musics…).

A small presentation of the project :

Click here to see the code.

item.title: Tic tac toe remix -> Gobblet Gobblers
item.description:
This was a first year project at the IUT, the purpose was to make in C, in command line, an improved version of the tic-tac-toe game, a bit more complex and give a make file that we can execute in order to compile the program. This project use dependancies only available in Linux, for windows you can use WSL to execute the program (available in the windows app store this allows you to simulate a Linux environnement very easily and fast). A small demonstration of the project launched with WSL :

Click here to see the code.

item.title: agario remix
item.description:
Click here to play

Another personnal project of mine which I started mostly as a joke (making an agario game where you can play with my friends’s faces) but ended up having to learn networking in order to make it playable online and it became a pretty big project. Quick remarks :

  • in the game clic in the direction you want to move
  • you can open the game in different tabs to see for yourself how it works with different players
  • have fun !

You can see the code here
